items.title: Een leven lang FC Groningen: 'Mijn moeders camera was meteen nat van het bier'
items.summary: Thom van Bergen, Jorg Schreuders en David van der Werff (allen uit 2004) groeiden op als supporters van FC Groningen; nu zijn ze belangrijke spelers in het eerste elftal. In het VI Kerstnummer halen de drie voetbalvrienden herinneringen op.

items.title: Bondscoach van Mali uit woede over minder Afrika Cups
items.summary: Tom Saintfiet vindt het enorm zonde dat het toernooi om de Afrika Cup in de toekomst nog maar eens in de vier jaar wordt georganiseerd. De Belgische bondscoach van Mali heeft zich uitgesproken over dat besluit.

items.title: Alles over de Afrika Cup: poules, stadions, speelschema en tv-zender
items.summary: Aan het einde van 2025 gaat de Afrika Cup van start. Voor veel Europese clubs betekent dat dat zij spelers een tijdje kwijt zijn, maar voor Afrika is het vooral een groot voetbalfeest. Voetbal International praat je bij over het toernooi.

items.title: Forest's 'greatest' John Robertson dies at 72
items.summary: Former Nottingham Forest and Scotland winger John Robertson has died at the age of 72, the Premier League club have announced.

items.title: Richards on U.S., Palace return: 'Won't be long'
items.summary: United States defender Chris Richards said it "won't be long" until he's back for Crystal Palace.

items.title: Zidane in stands for son Luca's Algeria clean sheet
items.summary: France great Zinedine Zidane watched his goalkeeper son's safe hands as Algeria started its Africa Cup of Nations campaign with a 3-0 win over 10-man Sudan on Wednesday.

items.title: Bar√ßa's Bonmat√≠ aims for April return to training
items.summary: Aitana Bonmat√≠ said that breaking her leg is giving her the chance to relax for the first time in five years after topping ESPN FC Women's Rank for the third time in a row.

items.title: Ten Hag: 'Weghorst kon niet goed koppen, maar wel goed denken'
items.summary: Wout Weghorst was in de eerste seizoenshelft, tot zijn blessure, de aanvalsleider van Ajax. Purist Rafael van der Vaart constateerde onlangs in de Pak Schaal Podcast met frisse tegenzin dat hij hem steeds meer ging waarderen. 'Ik krijg het niet uit mijn strot, maar ik raak langzaam gecharmeerd van Weghorst.'

items.title: Wijnaldum geeft zijn kerst kleur met w√©√©r een goal
items.summary: Georginio Wijnaldum heeft zich op eerste kerstdag met onder meer een doelpunt laten zien bij Al-Ettifaq. Voor de 35-jarige Nederlander en zijn teamgenoten was de overwinning op Al Riyadh pas de vierde van het seizoen in de Saoedische competitie.

items.title: Robertson was 'the scruffy fat lad who conquered Europe twice'
items.summary: Those who know him best look back on the illustrious career of John Robertson, Nottingham Forest's double European Cup winner.

items.title: Ex-Nottingham Forest and Scotland winger Robertson dies aged 72
items.summary: Former Nottingham Forest and Scotland winger John Robertson has died at the age of 72.

items.title: 'Picasso' of football Robertson dies aged 72
items.summary: Former Scotland, Nottingham Forest and Derby County winger John Robertson - once described by manager Brian Clough as "a Picasso of our game" - dies at the age of 72.

items.title: John Robertson, Nottingham Forest and Scotland legend, dies aged 72
items.summary: Winger was described by Clough as ‚ÄòPicasso of our game‚Äô Scored in Scotland‚Äôs 1981 win over England at Wembley John Robertson, the Nottingham Forest and Scotland legend, has died at the age of 72. Robertson was a hugely important part of the great Forest team that under Brian Clough rose from the second tier of English football to win multiple major honours, most famously back-to-back European Cups. Robertson assisted the decisive goal in the first European Cup triumph in 1979 and scored the decisive goal in the second, contributions that mark him out as one of the most remarkable players in British football history. He earned 28 Scotland caps, notably scoring the winning goal in a Home Championship victory over England at Wembley in May 1981. Clough described him as ‚Äúthe Picasso of our game‚Äù. Continue reading...

items.title: This will be the Premier League's quietest Boxing Day ever: Where did all the games go?
items.summary: The day after Christmas is usually jam-packed with great Premier League matchups, but not this year. What gives?

items.title: Liverpool praying for a golden sky after seven months of storms
items.summary: Despair and disorder have engulfed the club since their title party, leaving all concerned in need of previous serenity As Virgil van Dijk raised the Premier League trophy on a cool May afternoon at Anfield, the cap was sealed on a serenely glorious season for Liverpool. For sure there had been challenges en route to a 20th league title, but not many, and those that did arise were dealt with in a calm, orderly fashion. The ultimate prize had been captured with minimum sweat. Cue the celebrations after a final‚Äëday 1-1 draw with Crystal Palace: players and staff dancing on the pitch, supporters doing the same in the stands, and no sense this was as good as it was going to get for the just-crowned champions. It took less than 24 hours for everything to change and set in motion an astonishing seven‚Äëmonth period in the history of a club where it was probably thought they had seen and done it all. Continue reading...

items.title: Premier League and EFL to hold talks over ending Saturday 3pm blackout
items.summary: Leagues eager to sell all games in next rights cycle Auction for televised rights expected in 2027 The Premier League and EFL will hold talks early next year about combining to permit 3pm Saturday kick-offs to be broadcast live each week for the first time. The UK is the last country in Europe to apply the so-called 3pm blackout, and with the Premier League and EFL eager to sell all their games to domestic broadcasters in the next rights cycle they want an early agreement before the next tender. Continue reading...

items.title: ‚ÄòA quick learner‚Äô: how Declan Rice went from Chelsea reject to Arsenal‚Äôs Rolls-Royce
items.summary: Midfielder will be part of the conversation for a Ballon d‚ÄôOr if he continues his ascent with trophies for club and country Declan Rice likes to call it ‚Äúclean feedback‚Äù, which sounds like a euphemism for a bollocking, though he would probably say that is a misconception. Rather, it is part of the reason why Rice is being discussed as one of the best players in the world. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt eff and blind, you can‚Äôt bully people,‚Äù says Terry Westley, the head of West Ham‚Äôs academy when Rice was there. ‚ÄúBut we should be able to have a conversation and say: ‚ÄòLook, that ain‚Äôt quite good enough and we want to help you because this is what we need to do.‚Äô Continue reading...

items.title: Wiegman: How England won the Euros - again
items.summary: As Sarina Wiegman reflects on Euro 2025, a smile spreads across her face.

items.title: Bewildering and bewitching Newcastle seek solution to end chaos
items.summary: Despite tactical flaws and a fixture pile-up, Eddie Howe still has a ‚Äòglass half full‚Äô attitude before Manchester United trip Newcastle supporters are starting to regard Eddie Howe‚Äôs team as an unreliable friend. Catch them on the right night and they invariably prove the life and soul of the thrillingly high-intensity party but, on other days, the once-dependable Sandro Tonali and company simply fail to turn up. As if that were not bad enough, their second-half game management has become suffused with a chaotic streak. Howe‚Äôs players visit Manchester United on Boxing Day having dropped 13 Premier League points from winning positions this season and are without a clean sheet in 10 games in all competitions. Victory at Old Trafford would be only their second away league win. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Coolest thing I've done' - Lowry on Ryder Cup win after 'horrific' leaderboard
items.summary: Shane Lowry secured Team Europe's historic Ryder Cup title defence in New York, having been concerned about victory slipping through their grasp during a nail-biting Sunday.
